intro: Rhaponticum canariense, commonly known as the Canary Island rhapontic, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Rhaponticum canariense is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.
